parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To journey through (past). From dia and poreuomai; to travel through.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
A village, country town. From keimai; a hamlet.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
A journey, pursuit, undertaking, progress. From poreuomai; travel; figuratively proceedings, i.e. Career.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
